<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 265, 222, 280]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 289, 296, 304]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[750, 289, 866, 304]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[725, 314, 866, 328]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 379, 355]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 365, 371, 380]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 397, 214, 412]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 413, 836, 603]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 632, 205, 647]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 648, 697, 678]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 72, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 71, 769, 88]]<|/det|>
A line with equation \(y = mx - 6\) is a tangent to the curve with equation \(y = x^{2} - 4x + 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 100, 875, 133]]<|/det|>
Find the possible values of the constant \(m\), and the corresponding coordinates of the points at which the line touches the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 112, 875, 129]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 71, 91, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 71, 141, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 71, 326, 87]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 89, 541, 121]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\tan x + \sin x}{\tan x - \sin x} = k,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 121, 477, 140]]<|/det|>
where \(k\) is a constant, may be expressed as

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 146, 531, 177]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{1 + \cos x}{1 - \cos x} = k. \quad (2)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 152, 876, 170]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 425, 176, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[181, 425, 410, 444]]<|/det|>
Hence express \(\cos x\) in terms of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 428, 876, 447]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 666, 134, 685]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 660, 586, 688]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\tan x + \sin x}{\tan x - \sin x} = 4\) for \(-\pi < x < \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 663, 876, 682]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 72, 87, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[253, 81, 732, 205]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 223, 875, 257]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a triangle \(ABC\), in which angle \(ABC = 90^{\circ}\) and \(AB = 4 \text{cm}\). The sector \(ABD\) is part of a circle with centre \(A\). The area of the sector is \(10 \text{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 269, 141, 286]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 269, 361, 286]]<|/det|>
Find angle \(BAD\) in radians.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 270, 875, 286]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 470, 176, 488]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[181, 470, 455, 488]]<|/det|>
Find the perimeter of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 470, 875, 488]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 71, 91, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 69, 574, 88]]<|/det|>
Functions f and g are both defined for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\) and are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 94, 544, 114]]<|/det|>
\[\operatorname {f}(x) = x^{2} - 2x + 5,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 116, 552, 136]]<|/det|>
\[\operatorname {g}(x) = x^{2} + 4x + 13.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 153, 141, 171]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 153, 875, 188]]<|/det|>
By first expressing each of \(\operatorname {f}(x)\) and \(\operatorname {g}(x)\) in completed square form, express \(\operatorname {g}(x)\) in the form \(\operatorname {f}(x + p) + q\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 168, 875, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 617, 141, 636]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 617, 875, 636]]<|/det|>
Describe fully the transformation which transforms the graph of \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) to the graph of \(y = \operatorname {g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 70, 91, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 70, 138, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 69, 806, 88]]<|/det|>
Write down the first four terms of the expansion, in ascending powers of \(x\), of \((a - x)^6\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 70, 876, 87]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 304, 178, 323]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[178, 303, 876, 345]]<|/det|>
Given that the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(1 + \frac{2}{ax}\right)(a - x)^{6}\) is \(-20\), find in exact form the possible values of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 327, 875, 346]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 72, 141, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 71, 875, 103]]<|/det|>
An arithmetic progression \(P\) has first term \(a\) and common difference \(d\). An arithmetic progression \(Q\) has first term \(2(a + 1)\) and common difference \((d + 1)\). It is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[247, 106, 702, 140]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{5\mathrm{th}\mathrm{term}\mathrm{of}P}{12\mathrm{th}\mathrm{term}\mathrm{of}Q} = \frac{1}{3}\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \frac{\mathrm{Sum}\mathrm{of}\mathrm{first}5\mathrm{terms}\mathrm{of}P}{\mathrm{Sum}\mathrm{of}\mathrm{first}5\mathrm{terms}\mathrm{of}Q} = \frac{2}{3}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 147, 443, 165]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) and the value of \(d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 147, 876, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 71, 99, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[235, 79, 747, 288]]<|/det|>
